verses.verse: On that night<WH3915> could not<WH5074> the king<WH4428> sleep<WH8142>, and he commanded<WH559> to bring<WH935> the book<WH5612> of records<WH2146> of the chronicles<WH1697> <WH3117>; and they were read<WH7121> before<WH6440> the king<WH4428>. could: Heb. the king's sleep fled away

And it was found<WH4672> written<WH3789>, that Mordecai<WH4782> had told<WH5046> of Bigthana<WH904> and Teresh<WH8657>, two<WH8147> of the king's<WH4428> chamberlains<WH5631>, the keepers<WH8104> of the door<WH5592>, who sought<WH1245> to lay<WH7971> hand<WH3027> on the king<WH4428> Ahasuerus<WH325>. Bigthana: or, Bigthan door: Heb. threshold

And the king<WH4428> said<WH559>, What honour<WH3366> and dignity<WH1420> hath been done<WH6213> to Mordecai<WH4782> for this? Then said<WH559> the king's<WH4428> servants<WH5288> that ministered<WH8334> unto him, There is nothing<WH1697> done<WH6213> for him.

And the king<WH4428> said<WH559>, Who is in the court<WH2691>? Now Haman<WH2001> was come<WH935> into the outward<WH2435> court<WH2691> of the king's<WH4428> house<WH1004>, to speak<WH559> unto the king<WH4428> to hang<WH8518> Mordecai<WH4782> on the gallows<WH6086> that he had prepared<WH3559> for him.
And the king's<WH4428> servants<WH5288> said<WH559> unto him, Behold, Haman<WH2001> standeth<WH5975> in the court<WH2691>. And the king<WH4428> said<WH559>, Let him come in<WH935>.

So Haman<WH2001> came in<WH935>. And the king<WH4428> said<WH559> unto him, What shall be done<WH6213> unto the man<WH376> whom the king<WH4428> delighteth<WH2654> to honour<WH3366>? Now Haman<WH2001> thought<WH559> in his heart<WH3820>, To whom would the king<WH4428> delight<WH2654> to do<WH6213> honour<WH3366> more<WH3148> than to myself? whom the king: Heb. in whose honour the king delighteth
And Haman<WH2001> answered<WH559> the king<WH4428>, For the man<WH376> whom the king<WH4428> delighteth<WH2654> to honour<WH3366>, whom the king: Heb. in whose honour the king delighteth

Let the royal<WH4438> apparel<WH3830> be brought<WH935> which the king<WH4428> useth to wear<WH3847>, and the horse<WH5483> that the king<WH4428> rideth<WH7392> upon, and the crown<WH3804> royal<WH4438> which is set<WH5414> upon his head<WH7218>: Let: Heb. Let them bring the royal apparel which the king: Heb. wherewith the king clotheth himself

And let this apparel<WH3830> and horse<WH5483> be delivered<WH5414> to the hand<WH3027> of one<WH376> of the king's<WH4428> most noble<WH6579> princes<WH8269>, that they may array<WH3847> the man<WH376> withal whom the king<WH4428> delighteth<WH2654> to honour<WH3366>, and bring<WH7392> him on horseback<WH5483> through the street<WH7339> of the city<WH5892>, and proclaim<WH7121> before<WH6440> him, Thus shall it be done<WH6213> to the man<WH376> whom the king<WH4428> delighteth<WH2654> to honour<WH3366>. bring: Heb. cause him to ride

Then the king<WH4428> said<WH559> to Haman<WH2001>, Make haste<WH4116>, and take<WH3947> the apparel<WH3830> and the horse<WH5483>, as thou hast said<WH1696>, and do<WH6213> even so to Mordecai<WH4782> the Jew<WH3064>, that sitteth<WH3427> at the king's<WH4428> gate<WH8179>: let nothing<WH1697> fail<WH5307> of all that thou hast spoken<WH1696>. let: Heb. suffer not a whit to fall

Then took<WH3947> Haman<WH2001> the apparel<WH3830> and the horse<WH5483>, and arrayed<WH3847> Mordecai<WH4782>, and brought him on horseback<WH7392> through the street<WH7339> of the city<WH5892>, and proclaimed<WH7121> before<WH6440> him, Thus shall it be done<WH6213> unto the man<WH376> whom the king<WH4428> delighteth<WH2654> to honour<WH3366>.
And Mordecai<WH4782> came again<WH7725> to the king's<WH4428> gate<WH8179>. But Haman<WH2001> hasted<WH1765> to his house<WH1004> mourning<WH57>, and having his head<WH7218> covered<WH2645>.

And Haman<WH2001> told<WH5608> Zeresh<WH2238> his wife<WH802> and all his friends<WH157> every thing that had befallen<WH7136> him. Then said<WH559> his wise men<WH2450> and Zeresh<WH2238> his wife<WH802> unto him, If Mordecai<WH4782> be of the seed<WH2233> of the Jews<WH3064>, before<WH6440> whom thou hast begun<WH2490> to fall<WH5307>, thou shalt not prevail<WH3201> against him, but shalt surely<WH5307> fall<WH5307> before<WH6440> him.

And while they were yet talking<WH1696> with him, came<WH5060> the king's<WH4428> chamberlains<WH5631>, and hasted<WH926> to bring<WH935> Haman<WH2001> unto the banquet<WH4960> that Esther<WH635> had prepared<WH6213>.
